slug: /205
title: "This Week In React #205: Next.js, useActionState, Headless, d&d, Web Components, RSCs, Next-Safe-Action, Remix, Zustand, NumberFlow, Atomic-CSS-DevTools, ESLint, BottomSheet, edge-to-edge, Ignite, Metro, ES2025, Node.js, TypeScript..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 10-16-2024
---

segments.source_content: Hi everyone!

segments.source_content: This week we have a major Next.js RC release dropping just before Next.js Conf, many diverse releases, and great interactive blog posts.

translations.fr: Cette semaine, nous avons une version candidate majeure de Next.js publiÃ©e juste avant la Next.js Conf, de nombreuses sorties diverses et d'excellents articles de blog interactifs.

segments.source_content: The React Native world is quite active too, with many great releases from infrastructure packages you probably rely on. I heard v0.76 stable is around the corner!

segments.source_content: AG Charts is a canvas-based charting library from AG Grid. Initially built to power [AG Grids](https://www.ag-grid.com/react-table?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=2024-email-2) Integrated Charts, AG Charts now has over **1 million** npm downloads/month:

segments.source_content: [![Next.js 15 RC 2](/emails/issues/205/nextjs.jpg)](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-15-rc2)

translations.fr: [![Next.js 15 RC 2](/emails/issues/205/nextjs.jpg)](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-15-rc2)

segments.source_content: [**Next.js 15 RC 2**](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-15-rc2)

translations.fr: [**Next.js 15 RC 2**](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-15-rc2)

segments.source_content: Months after the first RC, another big one drops just before Next.js Conf, including:

translations.fr: Des mois aprÃ¨s la premiÃ¨re RC, une autre version majeure sort juste avant la Next.js Conf, incluant :
translations.en: Des mois aprÃ¨s la premiÃ¨re RC, une autre version majeure sort juste avant la Next.js Conf, incluant :

segments.source_content:
- `@next/codemod upgrade`: Easily upgrade to the latest Next.js and React versions.
- Turbopack for development: Performance improvements and Next.js 15 stability target.
- Async Request APIs (Breaking): Incremental step towards a simplified rendering and caching model.
- Server Actions: Enhanced security with unguessable endpoints and removal of unused actions.
- Static Indicator: New visual indicator shows static routes during development.
- `next/form`: Enhance HTML forms with client-side navigation.
- `next.config.ts`: TypeScript support for the Next.js configuration file.
- `instrumentation.js` (Stable): New API for server lifecycle observability.
- Development and Build improvements: Improved build times and Faster Fast Refresh.
- Self-hosting: More control over `Cache-Control` headers.
- ESLint 9

translations.fr:
- `@next/codemod upgrade` : Mise Ã  niveau simplifiÃ©e vers les derniÃ¨res versions de Next.js et React.
- Turbopack pour le dÃ©veloppement : AmÃ©liorations des performances et objectif de stabilitÃ© pour Next.js 15.
- API de requÃªte asynchrones (Breaking) : Ã‰tape progressive vers un modÃ¨le simplifiÃ© de rendu et de mise en cache.
- Server Actions : SÃ©curitÃ© renforcÃ©e avec des points de terminaison non devinables et suppression des actions inutilisÃ©es.
- Indicateur statique : Nouvel indicateur visuel montrant les routes statiques pendant le dÃ©veloppement.
- `next/form` : AmÃ©liore les formulaires HTML avec la navigation cÃ´tÃ© client.
- `next.config.ts` : Prise en charge de TypeScript pour le fichier de configuration Next.js.
- `instrumentation.js` (Stable) : Nouvelle API pour l'observabilitÃ© du cycle de vie du serveur.
- AmÃ©liorations du dÃ©veloppement et du build : Temps de build rÃ©duits et Fast Refresh plus rapide.
- Auto-hÃ©bergement : Plus de contrÃ´le sur les en-tÃªtes `Cache-Control`.
- ESLint 9
translations.en:
- `@next/codemod upgrade` : Mettez facilement Ã  jour vers les derniÃ¨res versions de Next.js et React.
- Turbopack pour le dÃ©veloppement : AmÃ©liorations des performances et cible de stabilitÃ© pour Next.js 15.
- API de requÃªte asynchrones (Changement majeur) : Ã‰tape progressive vers un modÃ¨le de rendu et de mise en cache simplifiÃ©.
- Actions serveur : SÃ©curitÃ© renforcÃ©e avec des points de terminaison impossibles Ã  deviner et suppression des actions inutilisÃ©es.
- Indicateur statique : Nouvel indicateur visuel montrant les routes statiques pendant le dÃ©veloppement.
- `next/form` : AmÃ©liorez les formulaires HTML avec la navigation cÃ´tÃ© client.
- `next.config.ts` : Prise en charge de TypeScript pour le fichier de configuration Next.js.
- `instrumentation.js` (Stable) : Nouvelle API pour l'observabilitÃ© du cycle de vie serveur.
- AmÃ©liorations du dÃ©veloppement et de la construction : Temps de build rÃ©duits et Fast Refresh plus rapide.
- Auto-hÃ©bergement : Plus de contrÃ´le sur les en-tÃªtes `Cache-Control`.
- ESLint 9

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Product for Engineers - The magic of small engineering teams](https://newsletter.posthog.com/p/the-magic-of-small-engineering-teams?utm_source=twir&utm_campaign=twir)
- ğŸ‘€ [React Core PR \- Re-land non-blocking prerendering](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/31238): The prerendering of Suspense siblings (blocking the v19 release) has been reverted due to breakages and is now re-introduced.
- ğŸ‘€ [Next.js PR draft \- experimental Request Interceptors](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/70961): This new feature could complement middleware and address some of its limitations with different tradeoffs.
- ğŸ‘€ [react-beautiful-dnd is now deprecated](https://github.com/atlassian/react-beautiful-dnd/issues/2672): Atlassian is now focusing on building â€œpragmatic drag and dropâ€.
- ğŸ—“ï¸Â [React Summit US](https://reactsummit.us/?utm_source=Newsletter&utm_medium=thisweekinreact) - ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸Â New-York - 19 & 22 December - Hurry and grab your ticket to the conference as prices are about to go up ! And donâ€™t forget your discount with code â€œTWIRâ€.
- ğŸ“œ [The True Nature of useActionState](https://www.nikhilsnayak.dev/blogs/the-true-nature-of-use-action-state): An interactive article that points out the API design similarities between `useReducer` and `useActionState`. It refactors an in-memory todo app using `useReducer` to use persistent/async storage. React 19 makes it convenient to turn an existing reducer async and move it to the server.
- ğŸ“œ [Headless, boneless, skinless & lifeless UI](https://nerdy.dev/headless-boneless-and-skinless-ui): Adam Argyle attempts to classify different React UI abstraction libraries more precisely than just â€œheadlessâ€.
- ğŸ“œ [Drag to Select](https://www.joshuawootonn.com/react-drag-to-select): This awesome interactive article explains how to implement a complex item selection UX in React, including various edge cases to consider such as user scrolling while dragging.
- ğŸ“œ [A Future for Web Components Without Shadow DOM](https://jjenzz.com/future-for-web-components-without-shadow-dom/): Jenna (RadixUI) shares interesting insight on Web Components from the perspective of a React design system dev. I thought Declarative Shadow DOM was required for SSR, but customized built-ins and custom attributes (proposal) might be better alternatives.
- ğŸ“œ [The Big "Server Waterfall Problem" with RSCs](https://www.epicreact.dev/server-waterfall-problem-rscs): Kent explains itâ€™s still possible to have waterfalls when using RSCs, but server-side waterfalls are less problematic than client-side waterfalls. The tension between query co-location and props drilling is not going away with RSCs.
- ğŸ“œ [How to prevent re-render in React with Tailwind CSS](https://www.nico.fyi/blog/tailwind-css-group-modifier-to-prevent-react-rerender): Adding data attributes at the top of the DOM tree could help reduce statefulness in deeply nested components. An interesting technique, often used for theming, not only for Tailwind users.
- ğŸ“œ [How to Use Next-Safe-Action for Your Server Actions](https://codelynx.dev/posts/next-safe-action-guide-en): Shows how to enhance Next.js Server Actions with Zod params validation, an access control middleware, normalized error management and React-Query integration.
- ğŸ“¦ [Zustand 5.0 \- No new feature, but twice smaller](https://github.com/pmndrs/zustand/releases/tag/v5.0.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [Number Flow \- A React component to transition, format, and localize numbers](https://github.com/barvian/number-flow)
- ğŸ“¦ [Atomic-CSS-DevTools](https://github.com/astahmer/atomic-css-devtools): This Chrome extension adds a dev tool panel for debugging atomic CSS rules as if they were not atomic. Works with Tailwind, StyleX, Pandaâ€¦
- ğŸ“¦ [Remix 2.13 \- Stabilizes `lazyRouteDiscovery`, `data`, `singleFetch`, `flushSync`, `viewTransition`](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#v2130)
- ğŸ“¦ [React Router 6.27 \- Stable `dataStrategy`, `patchRoutesOnNavigation`, `flushSync`, `viewTransition`](https://github.com/remix-run/react-router/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#v6270)
- ğŸ“¦ [ESLint-Plugin-React-Hooks 5.0 \- Support for ESLint 9](https://github.com/facebook/react/releases/tag/eslint-plugin-react-hooks%405.0.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [Astro 4.16 \- Concurrent Builds](https://github.com/withastro/astro/releases/tag/astro%404.16.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [Just-Styled \- Dead simple CSS-in-JS library for React 19+](https://github.com/yukukotani/just-styled)
- ğŸ¥ [Alem Tuzlak \- How React Router v7 became type-safe\!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ferLCqcLcGU)
- ğŸ¥ [Sam Selikoff \- Building a Reusable Component that Animates on Scroll](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GIIuG5_kyow)
- ğŸ™ï¸ [Syntax 833 \- Next Gen Fullstack React with TanStack](https://syntax.fm/show/833/next-gen-fullstack-react-with-tanstack)

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ‘€ [TC39 \- Updates from the 104th meeting](https://dev.to/hemanth/updates-from-the-104th-tc39-meeting-14cp): 14 proposals progressed, 4 of them reached stage 4 and ready to land in ES2025\!
- ğŸ‘€ [Companion Windows](https://github.com/explainers-by-googlers/companion-windows): Explainer from Google working on a web feature that could be the missing piece for MPAs, allowing them to preserve the state of dynamic widgets while navigating
- ğŸ“œ [Introducing Express v5: A New Era for Node.js Framework](https://expressjs.com/2024/10/15/v5-release): v5.0 has been published a few weeks ago, and we now have an official blog post with a list of breaking changes, also explaining why v5 is still not tagged as `latest`.
- ğŸ“¦ [Node.js 23.0 \- require(ESM) enabled by default](https://nodejs.org/en/blog/release/v23.0.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [TypeScript 5.7 Beta \- New checks, es2024 lib/target, relative path rewriting, perf](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-5-7-beta/)
- ğŸ“¦ [srvx \- Universal Server API based on web platform standards, works with Deno, Bun Node.js](https://github.com/unjs/srvx)
